content.question: Which of the following statements about the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 2 to the n power, and denominator 3 to the n power, plus n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: The series diverges by the <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> term test.

The series diverges by comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction 1 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series converges by comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 3 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The series converges by comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, two thirds, close parenthesis, to the n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The series converges by comparison to the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, open parenthesis, two thirds, close parenthesis, to the n power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
